title: Firefox Sync'd setting caused lost session
content:
Hi,

I had logged onto my Firefox sync account and shutdown my computer with "clear Firefox history on close" activated and can't recover my session even looking through my profiles folder for .jsonlz4 files.

Does this just clear my local history or is the sync'd history irrecoverable? (It seems like it is)

I've tried using window's file recovery tool to scan for the deleted files on my SSD but after reviewing the files with a hex editor, a huge top portion was zero'd out. Is this to do with TRIM or the data recovery tool just not picking up the right sectors?

title: fireFox
content: I am very annoyed by Fire FOX and the forced updates that cannot be turned off. If I can't turn this off somehow, I'll have to give up Fire Fox. I also find it terrible that I am being patronised, spied on and coerced by an organisation that pretends to be for people. Because that's what it is when they check against my will whether I have installed the new update. Even if it's free, I don't deserve it. Then I'd rather pay for my freedom. It is terrible that this software sniffs out whether I need an update and then annoys me with it. I can take care of myself and my security and don't need Mozilla for that. I just wanted a browser and not a mum. Can anyone tell me what parameters to change in this about:config so that Firefox no longer communicates with its base against my will and no longer reminds me to download updates?

title: Sekmeler arası geçişlerde büyük sorun!
content: Merhabalar. Firefox tarayıcısını uzun zamandır alternatiflerine tercih ederek hem mobil cihazlarımda hemde bilgisayarlarımda ana tarayıcım olarak memnuniyetle kullanıyorum. Teknolojik açıdan kendimi sizden yardım alacak ve sorunumu rahatça anlatacak kadar yeterli buluyorum. Kullandığım cihazların ana performanslarında herhangi bir sorun olmadığını en başta belirtmek isterim. Bilgisayarda kullandığım tarayıcım (Son sürümü güncel) Maalesef bir süredir sekmeler arasında gezerken donma olarak tabir edilebilecek kısa aralıklı takıntılar yaşıyorum. Bu takılmalar sadece mozilla tarayıcımda gerçekleşiyor ve takılmanın bitmesini beklerken diğer tarayıcılara geçiş yapmak zorunda kalıyorum. Çok uzun süredir kullandığım mozilla tarayıcımda ilk kez böyle birşey başıma geldiğinden bir süre düzelmesini bekledim ancak 2 kez yeni güncelleme gelmesine rağmen sorunum çözüme ulaşmadı. Bu sorun özellikle sekmeler arasında hızlıca gezerken ortaya çıkıyor. Sorunun tarafınızca daha iyi anlaşılabilmesi için size ekran alıntısı şeklinde bir video gönderebilirim. Eğer ihtiyaç duyarsanız lütfen bana hazeralimusa@gmail.com adresinden ulaşın. İyi çalışmalar dilerim.
creator: hazeralimusa

title: mouse middle button click on firefox nightly window top bar fails to lower window on Ubuntu 21.04
content:
On normal firefox 88.0 (64-bit) this works OK

on firefox nightly 90.0a1 (2021-04-26) (64-bit) this is broken

Normal window behavior on all applications on Ubuntu the window will stay open yet get pushed to become behind all other open windows when you mouse middle button click on the windows top "Title Bar"

By default firefox will NOT display this "Title Bar" on standard normal firefox you enable showing that "Title Bar" by hamburger menu -> Customize Toolbar -> checkmark ON Title Bar ... well that menu is now gone from nightly as of last week however through other settings I am able to enable the "Title Bar" however this push to go behind behavior fails to happen ... please fix ... over the years this same feature similarily disappears for a few weeks only to get fixed again so I have hope it will get fixed .... Please put this feature into checklist when making changes to the code !!!!!

thanks for making firefox the BEST browser by far ... especially on Android

title: Nothing but white windows in Firefox for 2 weeks
content:
I have very much came to depend on Firefox. I've tried everything mentioned to users with same problem. Even Passwords and Settings have white windows (no text or anything else showing. When I reinstall Firefox I get vcruntime140_1.dll error. How can I fix it? I have the latest update.

While writing this I went back to double check the vcruntime140_1.dll install. I found it wasn't on the main Mozilla Directory - so I copied it. And now Firefox works! The file came from https://www.dll-files.com/. I don't need any further assistance.

Just leaving this as a record for others who may be having a hard time.

Thanks Mozilla for all you do!

title: Mozilla-provided font (I think) is just annoying/hard to read
content:
I've read some complaints about the font that FF desktop uses on some websites. I'm seeing a very annoying font with some letters thicker (almost bold) and other letters thin. This occurs, for example, on the mozilla.org website and when FF is displaying a PDF.

I have "allow pages to choose their own fonts" checked, and I am not using hardware acceleration.

I went into the developer console and turned off the Mozilla-supplied font for a support webpage, and it then used something like a Times New Roman, but it was uniform in letter thickness.

I have attached screen snips.

If I display the same page using Chrome, the font looks great, so I don't know exactly what the problem is, but it's clearly a FF problem.

Notice in Chrome that the word "garbled" is in bold, and it does not appear in bold in either of the FF font examples.

content: Since last week, I haven't been able to visualize websites like Canva, Google Drive, Swagbucks, and some others.They just don't load or don't display parts of the page, please see attached screenshots. I have needed to use another browser and it is very inconvenient as I have all my add-ons and customizations on Firefox. Please check it!

title: Firefox Browser shuts unepectedly and all settings are lost
content: Hello, since a few month the browser is shutting unexpectedly every couple of hours and all settings like starting page or prefered search engine are lost. There is no error message or error report. I'm using lates MAC OS and Firefox version (it happened also with the last couple of versions)
creator: markusfeil

title: Firefox Developer Edition : Hangs after initial load.
content:
Hi everyone!

My firefox developer edition was working perfectly fine until recently. (macOS)

Now it hangs (picture provided) every single time it boots. Nothing is clickable or loads, or is responsive, except the search bar where you can type things in but pressing enter will not do anything.

I have unsuccessfully attempted to boot it in 'safe mode' using the holding down option and using terminal with this line: /Applications/Firefox\ Developer\ Edition.app/Contents/MacOS/firefox -safe-mode

Please help!! :)
creator: martinang2

title: Privacy Mozilla
content:
Meanwhile, we know that Mozilla doesn't give a damn about anyone else's privacy either. This is partly due to continuous data sharing with Google and so on. Also the fact that Mozilla has no contact possibilities, they prefer not to get feedback apparently, shows that they don't care about the customer.

But now it gets even worse, the Nightly version now starts up automatically (without actually opening) with Windows. And immediately wants to share data with third party servers, I can see from the notification of my firewall. How can I turn this off?

And the new layout, with all its unnecessary extra space, doesn't look good at all. Yet another failure of Mozilla. It is that there is no better browser, but otherwise...
creator: bram3

title: drm is enabled and always activate is on but will not work for spotify
content: as above

title: Pop up windows are now being blocked on a site I have allowed pop up windows
content: I have checked and I am running the latest version of Firefox Something has changed. When I go to a website I regularly use to view information a pop up window has to open. For a long using this site opening pop up windows has not been a problem after I allowed the site to open pop up windows. Now when I use the site to view this information Firefox blocks the pop up and in the options presented to me I have to choose show the requested pop up window. The choice to allow pop ups from this site is shown but I cannot click on it. When I check the list of allowed sites for pop ups this site is shown
creator: cn.cochran72

title: Firefox for Mac won'tplay movies on Netflix or Amazon
content:
I just reinstalled Firefox. It is up to date and is my default browser. It won't play movies on Netflix or Amazon. I get a thin yellow strip at the top of the movie window saying that WidevineCdm crashed. This happens every time I try to play a Netflix movie. 

    Before throwing my old Firefox off the computer and reinstalling the same version (78.10), Everything worked fine. but the old Firefox had some issues.  It would crash sometimes and there were some security issues.  Since reinstallation it doesn't crash but now it won't play Netflix or Amazon movies.        I went to Firefox listing of crash reports.  Below is a copy of one of them:

creator: patrickmok1

title: Feedback: Please return "Take screenshoot" button to the "page actions" menu.
content:
Hi to all the developers:

To take screenshoots was a great success, and it was quite agile to take snapshots with the "page actions" menu, but the last update (FF 88.0) disappeared that option.

Please return the "Take screenshoot" button" to the "page actions" menu. This seems to be an unimportant thing, but having the button on the toolbar reduces space, especially if we take into account that there are other buttons showing information. (Img1)

But the worst thing is when some web pages appear in pop-up windows that do not show any buttons. So, how can I take a screenshot if the capture button does not appear. (Img2)

Please keep in mind that there are some people that need to take several screenshots and it is faster to activate the capture and select the desired area both with the mouse.

Since the feedback page seems to be not working, I write it here with the greatest respect, to get this to the developers.

Thank you in advance.
creator: darkjorge1013

title: Screen shot problem
content: When I use the built in screenshot on a web page (right click menu) and then paste it into an email in Thunderbird the screenshot does not show what I selected. It always shows a different area or only a part of the original selection. When I take the same screenshot in the Edge web browser and paste it into an email in Thunderbird it works correctly. I would like it to work correctly in Firefox. Thank you Jeanbold text

title: Sync and Firefox versions over GNU+Linux distros
content:
Hi,

I'm using Firefox over various devices and systems.

For instance: - Firefox binary downloaded from Mozilla website and executed over Debian Testing - Firefox from Arch Linux official repositories in Arch systems

My doubt is: could this cause any problem with the Sync function? Or Sync has the flexibility to allow syncing between a wide specter of Firefox installations

For instance: Could I add Fennec from F-Droid to my LineageOS smartphone or Firefox-ESR from Debian repositories to my desktop machine, log in with my account in all of them and synchronize all the sessions without problems?

Thanks a lot in advance!, and let me know if I should add any technical information.

Kind regards!
creator: rv.sin.mail

title: Cannot find a way to run extension properly
content:
Just now I was about to use <Zotero Connector> add-on. But I cannot find its iconic to click in toolbar as usual.

Also I found all extensions iconic were removed. I can find them in Add-ons Manager where only enable or disable is allowed to choose but, some of them should take extra user input to run e.g. save to cloud / save to local which, in previous days, are gotten via second click after first click on the iconic.

I tried to drag them into toolbars but found none available in candidates.

Could someone tell me Where can I run the second click?
creator: yongliang.c

title: Mozilla Pop-up asks   "Add Outlook.live.com as an application for mailto: links"
content:
Is the above popup legit? I ask because, MSFT has for about 26 years refused to fix the mailto: problem, meaning any mailto: link address had to be written down, and then typed out in whatever e-mail application the user had. One could not even copy and paste it.

This happened despite the fact that even under MSDOS 6.22 such links were easily automated and functional. Since it is unbelievable that Microsoft suddenly sees the light (any light), I am asking whether this is some kind of a scam.

Secondly, if it is legit, does this application link to a) The big complicated Outlook, or b) the Outlook.com you can reach via the www.msn.com page, or c) the Outlook Mail App one can find both on Windows 10 desktops or on any "dumb" smart phone?

Third, does this App destroy anything?

Fourth, can this App be removed without destroying anything?

Does anyone know anything about this?

If nobody knows, forward this to Satjan Nutella. Thank You!
creator: voodooquantum

title: Video file wont play on blog site?
content: Recently downloaded a video clip, played it on my pc, not a problem, and then uploaded the same clip to a blog site, but it does not play?? All that shows is the opening scene, and nothing else? The audio is working perfectly? I've not had this happen with any other clip I download and then re-upload to another site...can anyone assist with this please ?
creator: 16emtec

title: I need View Image
content: Firefox removed the "View Image" option from the right click menu. You can "open image in new tab" but that is not the same thing and is not what I'm trying to do. The inconvenience of this removal is driving me mad. "View Image" was literally the only thing Firefox had for me over Chrome and I would really like it back. Is there any way to customize or modify Firefox to regain this option? Or if a developer is hearing this, can you bring back that option somehow? I don't want to run an older version of FIrefox just to have it work, especially with the security risk that poses.
creator: winsterton

title: Is there a way to change the background of the suggested search from bright blue?
content: Hello, I'm new to Firefox, and I like it a lot so far, but I'm having a bit of an issue with one thing. When I search something using the url/search bar, search suggestions appear beneath. I like this, and don't want to get rid of the feature, but the fact that it is highlighted in bright blue is pretty hard on my eyes. I was wondering if there is a way to lower the brightness, or make it transparent? Any help would be very much appreciated!
